channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Checkout.com Rejects Ransom After ShinyHunters Breach, Donates to Research
item.description:
The global payment processor Checkout.com has disclosed a data breach orchestrated by the ShinyHunters cybercrime group. The attackers exploited a legacy third-party cloud file storage system that was improperly decommissioned. After being contacted with a ransom demand, Checkout.com refused to pay....

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Washington Post Breached by Clop Ransomware via Oracle Flaws
item.description:
The Washington Post has officially confirmed it was a victim of a large-scale cyberattack orchestrated by the Clop ransomware group. The threat actors exploited vulnerabilities in Oracle's E-Business Suite, compromising over 100 organizations globally. The campaign involves data exfiltration followe...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Synnovis Confirms Patient Data Stolen in Qilin Ransomware Attack on London Hospitals
item.description:
Pathology service provider Synnovis has officially confirmed that patient personal data, including names, NHS numbers, and dates of birth, was stolen during the June 2024 ransomware attack attributed to the Qilin gang. The attack caused widespread disruption to London hospitals, leading to the cance...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Clop Ransomware Gang Claims Attack on Dartmouth College, Threatens to Leak Data
item.description:
The notorious Clop ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Dartmouth College, an Ivy League university in the U.S. On November 11, 2025, the group added the institution to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish exfiltrated data if the university does not enter ne...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: Nikkei Slack Breach Exposes Data of 17,000 Users via Stolen Credentials
item.description:
Japanese media giant Nikkei Inc., owner of the Financial Times, has disclosed a significant data breach affecting its internal Slack workspace. An attacker gained access using authentication credentials stolen from an employee's personal computer, which was infected with infostealer malware. The inc...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Malware

item.title: Hyundai IT Affiliate Discloses Major Data Breach Exposing PII and SSNs
item.description:
Hyundai AutoEver America, the IT services subsidiary of the Hyundai Group, has begun notifying customers of a major data breach that occurred between late February and early March 2025. The incident involved unauthorized access to the company's IT environment, exposing highly sensitive personally id...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Other

item.title: China's Cyber Arsenal Exposed: Knownsec Breach Leaks State Hacking Tools and Global Target Lists
item.description:
A monumental data breach at Knownsec, a prominent Chinese cybersecurity firm with close government ties, has resulted in the exposure of over 12,000 classified documents. The leak, which occurred in early November 2025, provides an unprecedented view into China's offensive cyber capabilities, reveal...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

item.title: Swedish IT Supplier Breach Exposes Personal Data of 1.5 Million Citizens
item.description:
The 'Datacarry' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a major cyberattack on Miljödata, a Swedish IT supplier for local governments, exposing the sensitive personal data of up to 1.5 million people. The attack, which occurred in August 2025, targeted the company's HR systems, leading to th...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Akira Ransomware Hits US Manufacturer Koch & Co., Threatens to Leak 54GB of Data
item.description:
The Akira ransomware group has added U.S. manufacturer Koch & Co., Inc. to its list of victims. In a November 7 post on its dark web leak site, the group claimed to have stolen 54 gigabytes of sensitive corporate data, including detailed financials, contracts, and HR files. Akira is threatening to p...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

item.title: Data of Nearly 200,000 Supporters of Hungarian Party TISZA Leaked Online
item.description:
The personal data of nearly 200,000 supporters of the Hungarian political party TISZA has been leaked and is being widely distributed online. The breach, which occurred in October 2025, originated from the party's "TISZA Világ" service. The compromised dataset, containing 198,500 records, has been a...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach
